page.title: 04THE SMITHY AT NANTGLYN.
page.content: The building to show local history is the 200 year old blacksmiths forge, now used as a craftshop. Originally the blacksmiths would shoe horses and cattle before their long journey to be sold in England. The leatherworker,a Californian, has kept the artefacts from the old smithy, such as saddles, horseshoes, blinkers, shears and animal traps. He has a large single bellows, 150 years old which still works. A hundred year old bellows is used to light his wood burning stove.The old ranges and suspended chimney hoods are still in good condition, so is the slate flagged floor. The best quality leather bags are sold for Â£48, and purses bracelets and keyrings are around Â£1.Nantglyn is off the main tourist routes so most of the crafts are sold elsewhere.
